By  Jarrod RiceNovember  

The dominance over Toledo continued for the NIU volleyball team in the first round of the MAC tournament Tuesday night at Victor E PERIOD Court PERIOD

The No PERIOD  seeded Huskies  overall  MAC swept all three games by scores of   and  and beat the No PERIOD  seed Toledo for the third time in a span of  days PERIOD

NIU will play No PERIOD  Ball State  in the quarterfinals Friday at a tournament hosted by Bowling Green PERIOD NIU split its two meetings with Ball State this season sweeping the Cardinals in its last match Nov PERIOD  PERIOD

Against Toledo the Huskies jumped out to a  lead in Game  behind five kills from senior Tera Lobdell who won her second straight MAC Player of the Week award Monday PERIOD

A good start is always important to us and we were able to maintain it NIU coach Ray Gooden said PERIOD We gave up some points here and there but we never allowed any big six or sevenpoint runs. toledo   grabbed its first lead of the match in Game   but an  run by the Huskies put them behind for good PERIOD

NIU had a . hitting percentage in Game  which was its lowest of the match but still captured the win PERIOD

We blocked hard and were able to key in the middle junior setter Marie Zidek said PERIOD I think even though we beat them twice already we had our backs against the wall because the third time playing a team is tough. game  was the Huskies best on both sides of the ball as they hit . and held Toledo to a matchlow . pERIOD

Lobdell and senior middle blocker Megan Markowski had seven kills and five digs apiece in the clincher PERIOD

They played us tough for two and a half games but as we continue to play we continue to communicate better Gooden said PERIOD Right now we are where the best teams want to be and we are getting confident. advertisement
